snippet: Xiao Jianhua said the company he co-founded was helping the family of China’s president dispose of assets when the company bought a stake that the family held in an investment firm.
abstract: Billionaire Chinese financier Xiao Jianhua asserts that company he co-founded helped family of China’s Pres Xi Jinping dispose of some of its assets in 2013 when the company bought a stake that the family held in a state-backed investment firm; statement is partly intended to dispute elements of a profile of Xiao’s rise as a businessman after the Tiananmen Square demonstrations in 1989.

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and MICHAEL FORSYTHE

lead_paragraph: Xiao Jianhua said the company he co-founded was helping the family of China’s president dispose of assets when the company bought a stake that the family held in an investment firm.
